transportAdvice: Brussels has an extensive public transit network including metro, tram, and bus lines that connect most tourist areas efficiently. The historic center is compact and very walkable, while taxis are widely available for longer journeys or late-night travel.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent rain and occasional frost; pack warm, waterproof layers.
Still cold and damp with overcast skies, though daylight hours begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings mild temperatures and occasional sunny spells mixed with showers.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming parks, though rain showers remain common.
Warm and increasingly sunny, making it a comfortable time to explore the city on foot.
Early summer is mild and enjoyable with long evenings and occasional afternoon showers.
The warmest month with pleasant temperatures, though brief thunderstorms can occur.
Warm summer conditions continue with a mix of sunshine and occasional rain.
Early autumn brings cooler, comfortable temperatures and a gradual increase in rainfall.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with autumn foliage; a light jacket and umbrella are essential.
Cold, damp, and frequently overcast; the city's Christmas markets begin to open late in the month.
Cold and grey with festive Christmas markets providing a lively atmosphere despite the chill.
